text: Definition A context-free grammar (CFG) consists of e a set of terminals X e a set of non-terminals N e a start symbol S € N e a set P of production rules. Every production rule is of the form Y=X...Xn where Y € N is a (single) non-terminal, and X; € (EUN)",0 < i < n can be a terminal or non-terminal.
